content: Is the monster in Mary Shelley's novel Frankenstein named Frankenstein?

No, the monster in Mary Shelley's novel "Frankenstein" is not named Frankenstein. The title of the novel refers to the scientist who creates the monster, Dr. Victor Frankenstein. The monster itself is often mistakenly called "Frankenstein," but in the novel, it is referred to as the "creature" or the "monster."
